ajeffrey.teaching.debug

Interface Debug

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DebugStream
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DebugImpl

    public interface Debug
extends DebugStream
    An inferface for printing debugging messages.
    Version:
    1.0.5
    Author:
    Alan Jeffrey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Debug out
      A debugging output stream.

    • Field Detail

      • out

        static final Debug out
        A debugging output stream. This output stream will print messages including thread identifiers, to keep track of safety errors caused by concurrent programming.

    • Method Detail

      • addFactory

        void addFactory(DebugStreamFactory factory)
        Adds a new debug factory. This factory will be used to build new debug streams when debug messages are printed. Each thread is given its own debug stream to print to.
        Parameters:
        factory - factory to build new debugging streams

      • addPrintStream

        void addPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Adds a new print stream
        Parameters:
        out - an output stream to send messages to

      • addOutputStream

        void addOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Adds a new output stream
        Parameters:
        out - an output stream to send messages to

      • addFile

        void addFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Adds a new print stream
        Parameters:
        out - an output stream to send messages to
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • setPrintStream

        void setPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Adds a new print stream
        Parameters:
        out - an output stream to send messages to

      • println

        void println(java.lang.String msg)
        Prints a debugging message.
        Specified by:
        println in interface DebugStream
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to print

      • breakPoint

        void breakPoint(java.lang.String msg)
        Prints a debugging message, and adds a break point where execution may pause (if using a step debugger). Note: if you do this in the main GUI thread, you may cause all GUI processing to halt!
        Specified by:
        breakPoint in interface DebugStream
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to print

      • assertion

        void assertion(boolean assertion)
        Makes an assertion. If the assertion is false, we add a break point.
        Parameters:
        assertion - the assertion to check.
